2018-04-29T14:15:16Z: Here is our report from an absolutely bonkers race. Keep up with all the fallout on Autosport.com and Motorsport.com tonight and from Monday onwards, and we'll see you again for the Spanish Grand Prix: Lewis Hamilton gets Baku F1 win amid chaos, Red Bulls collideLewis Hamilton stole Azerbaijan Grand Prix victory from Valtteri Bottas after a safety car caused by the Red Bull Formula 1 drivers colliding set up a dramatic Baku finish
2018-04-29T14:10:25Z: It's fair to say that by Hamilton's standards these are subdued victory celebrations. He's won enough races to know when one has come about more through luck than blowing everyone away. They're all worth the same number of points though!
2018-04-29T14:02:52Z: Here's a new one - we're getting the post-race interviews before the podium. The drivers are going to speak in parc ferme.
2018-04-29T13:58:34Z: Retirements: Bottas, Grosjean, Verstappen, Ricciardo, Hulkenberg, Ocon, Sirotkin
2018-04-29T13:58:17Z: Result: 1 Hamilton; 2 Raikkonen; 3 Perez; 4 Vettel; 5 Sainz; 6 Leclerc; 7 Alonso; 8 Stroll; 9 Vandoorne; 10 Hartley; 11 Ericsson; 12 Gasly; 13 Magnussen
2018-04-29T13:57:44Z: Raikkonen takes second, and Perez holds off Vettel!
2018-04-29T13:57:33Z: Lewis Hamilton wins the Azerbaijan Grand Prix!
2018-04-29T13:57:14Z: An incident between Gasly and Magnussen - which mean explain why Magnussen went from the points to the back at the restart - will be investigated after the race.
2018-04-29T13:57:11Z: Perez is going to need a very good exit from Turn 16 to prevent Vettel from towing past him on the long run to the flag.
2018-04-29T13:56:49Z: Alonso and Stroll are having a massive battle over seventh place, which is giving Leclerc ahead in sixth a bit of peace.
2018-04-29T13:56:45Z: Hamilton leads by nearly three seconds from Raikkonen. All eyes on the battle for third: Perez v Vettel.
2018-04-29T13:56:25Z: The last lap begins, and Vettel has got back on with it. He's tucked under the rear wing of Perez now. Can he break Force India hearts?
2018-04-29T13:55:34Z: Replays show Bottas ran over a pretty big piece of debris on the start/finish straight to cause that instant tyre blowout.
2018-04-29T13:55:22Z: Vandoorne has come from 14th at the restart to ninth.
2018-04-29T13:55:12Z: Hamilton continues to pull away from Raikkonen.
2018-04-29T13:54:43Z: Vettel has regained his composure and got back onto Perez's tail for third.
2018-04-29T13:54:27Z: Sainz gets down the outside of Leclerc into Turn 1 and takes fifth from the Sauber.
2018-04-29T13:53:57Z: Hamilton leads Raikkonen by two seconds with two laps to go.
2018-04-29T13:53:10Z: Vettel will now come under pressure from Leclerc for fourth.
2018-04-29T13:53:00Z: This race has fallen into Hamilton's lap!
2018-04-29T13:52:48Z: It's a right-rear puncture for Bottas. That must be because of debris, as those tyres are only eight laps old.
2018-04-29T13:52:46Z: Perez sweeps past the flatspotted Vettel and into what becomes third as Bottas slows.
2018-04-29T13:52:15Z: Leclerc grabbed sixth from Sainz at the restart, and Alonso snatched eighth from Stroll. Magnussen tumbled from 10th to 14th and Vandoorne jumped from 14th to 11th.
2018-04-29T13:51:49Z: Vettel reports a big flat spot. We. Are. Shocked.
2018-04-29T13:51:23Z: Disaster for the championship leader. He went from defending against Hamilton to attacking Bottas and suffering a huge lock-up.
2018-04-29T13:51:02Z: Bottas leads from Hamilton, Raikkonen and Vettel.
2018-04-29T13:50:45Z: Vettel lunges for the lead and locks up! He's down to fourth!
2018-04-29T13:50:26Z: Hamilton shapes up to attack Vettel...
2018-04-29T13:50:18Z: Bottas goes early - he's away and we are racing again.
2018-04-29T13:50:08Z: Get ready for four laps of Mercedes v Ferrari.
2018-04-29T13:49:44Z: Will Bottas do the same as Vettel and wait a very long time to go - to make sure it's not a long full-speed drag to Turn 1?
2018-04-29T13:48:30Z: Vettel asks how Raikkonen got on with the ultrasofts in the first stint, before correcting himself when he remembers that Raikkonen had an incident on lap one and pitted immediately.
2018-04-29T13:47:53Z: The recovery truck is now pulling away from the scene of Grosjean's crash.
2018-04-29T13:46:04Z: Grosjean has arrived back in the Haas garage and thrown his gloves away in huge frustration.
2018-04-29T13:45:09Z: Just before his crash, Grosjean was complaining over the radio that if lapped cars were going to be let past then the safety car was going to go on for ages and tyres would get very cold...
2018-04-29T13:41:53Z: Haas lets Magnussen know that his team-mate Grosjean is unhurt, in case the precautionary presence of the medical car on track alarms him.
2018-04-29T13:41:23Z: Grosjean's bizarre exit elevates Sainz, Leclerc, Stroll, Alonso and Magnussen into sixth to 10th places.
2018-04-29T13:39:13Z: Grosjean was running sixth and looks like he just lost it while warming his tyres and slammed into the wall.
2018-04-29T13:38:38Z: Grosjean is in the wall under the safety car!
2018-04-29T13:37:44Z: Hamilton is worried that he's glazed one of his brakes, but he's told it's still OK.
2018-04-29T13:36:57Z: This is probably going to be quite spicy in the paddock after the race - and the rancour has already begun, here's Ocon slamming Raikkonen over their first-lap clash: Esteban Ocon critical of Kimi Raikkonen over Azerbaijan GP contactEsteban Ocon has hit out at Kimi Raikkonen following their accident during the Azerbaijan Grand Prix, saying the Finn doesn't belong in Ferrari.
2018-04-29T13:35:11Z: Order under safety car: 1 Bottas; 2 Vettel; 3 Hamilton; 4 Raikkonen; 5 Perez; 6 Grosjean; 7 Sainz; 8 Leclerc; 9 Stroll; 10 Alonso; 11 Magnussen; 12 Gasly; 13 Hartley; 14 Vandoorne; 15 Ericsson
2018-04-29T13:33:02Z: The rest of the upper midfield is pitting and changing tyres too, all going onto ultrasofts except Perez, who goes for supersofts.
2018-04-29T13:32:52Z: Perhaps Ferrari decided that if Vettel had lost track position due to the safety car, he might as well get some fresh tyres to fight Bottas to the end.
2018-04-29T13:32:26Z: Crucially, Bottas now leads the race thanks to being able to pit under the safety car, and Vettel deciding to come in as well.
2018-04-29T13:31:46Z: Raikkonen pits, and he also takes ultrasofts.
2018-04-29T13:31:21Z: Hamilton has pitted as well. Everyone takes fresh ultrasofts at the front.
2018-04-29T13:30:13Z: Mercedes is ready to pit Bottas.
2018-04-29T13:29:51Z: Disaster for Red Bull. Both cars are in the Turn 1 escape road with a lot of damage.
2018-04-29T13:29:33Z: Ricciardo rear-ends Verstappen on the brakes into Turn 1! It's ended in tears!
2018-04-29T13:29:13Z: Verstappen is weaving around - trying to avoid the tow.
2018-04-29T13:28:17Z: So pitting second has worked out perfectly for Verstappen in that Red Bull fight - he's regained track position. Will he struggle on his out-lap like Ricciardo did?
2018-04-29T13:27:20Z: Verstappen pits, and he takes ultrasofts as well.
2018-04-29T13:27:04Z: Bottas, Vettel and Hamilton all put in 1m45.5s laps that time around.
2018-04-29T13:25:40Z: Ricciardo is the first Red Bull to put, and he takes ultrasofts for the final stint.
2018-04-29T13:25:22Z: Fastest lap for Bottas - 1m45.1s, eight tenths faster than Hamilton.
2018-04-29T13:24:47Z: Perez has now got 2.8s of breathing space over Grosjean in their battle for seventh, with the chasing Sainz, Leclerc, Stroll group on a similar pace.
2018-04-29T13:22:53Z: Ricciardo was one second quicker than Verstappen on that first lap ahead of him, but Verstappen has settled in behind him now and he's not exactly clearing off.
2018-04-29T13:21:54Z: Fastest lap for Hamilton, who is now clawing time back to Bottas.
2018-04-29T13:21:02Z: That big tow from Verstappen helped Ricciardo set another fastest lap - 1m45.419s.
2018-04-29T13:20:41Z: Lock up from the Australian but he keeps it out of the wall into Turn 1, and Verstappen can't get back at him at Turn 2 this time. Ricciardo has finally made the move stick. Can he get away?
2018-04-29T13:20:09Z: Ricciardo passes Verstappen into Turn 1 again!
2018-04-29T13:18:42Z: Verstappen is complaining about tyre temperatures. Ricciardo is still in his mirrors.
2018-04-29T13:18:23Z: Fastest lap for Bottas - 1m45.5s. Hamilton is complaining about backmarkers as he loses more time.
2018-04-29T13:17:58Z: Red Bull have provided plenty of entertainment in this race, but let's not forget neither driver has stopped and they are still behind Vettel and Hamilton.
2018-04-29T13:16:50Z: Hamilton matches Bottas's pace next time around. Has Bottas got anything left to build enough of a gap to get ahead?
2018-04-29T13:16:25Z: Perez continues to fend off Grosjean for seventh place. They're 9s clear of Sainz and 12s ahead of Leclerc, and are trying to go as far as they can with the tyres they put on under the early safety car.
2018-04-29T13:13:36Z: Vettel rejoins 8.5s ahead of Hamilton, which is roughly what the gap was when Hamilton pitted. That shows Hamilton didn't gain from the earlier stop, mainly because it took the softs so long to get working. Hamilton's only hope would be if Vettel struggles to get the softs working as well.
2018-04-29T13:12:38Z: Vettel pits, taking softs. Bottas leads.
2018-04-29T13:11:48Z: Hamilton puts in a personal best, but that's three tenths down on Bottas.
2018-04-29T13:11:13Z: Fastest lap for Bottas  - 1m45.8s. He's 9.5s behind Vettel, and 18.6s ahead of Hamilton.
2018-04-29T13:09:59Z: Perez in seventh now has Grosjean right on his tail, but both are set to drop back behind Sainz, Leclerc and potentially Stroll if they have to pit again. They're running tyres they put on in very early pitstops.
2018-04-29T13:09:07Z: Alonso loses another place to Stroll, having had a huge lock-up and visited the Turn 1 escape road. He's 12th now.
2018-04-29T13:08:39Z: Hamilton asks if his soft tyres will make it to the end, and he's told it should be fine.
2018-04-29T13:08:24Z: Hamilton is now quicker than Vettel and Bottas. He's 29s off the lead, and 18s behind his team-mate.
2018-04-29T13:07:38Z: Ricciardo posted the fastest lap as he tried to make that pass on Verstappen.
2018-04-29T13:06:53Z: Ricciardo thinks he's got a pass done at Turn 1 around the outside, covers the line into Turn 2, or so he thinks! Verstappen slams it down the inside again, and regains the place. Somehow they didn't quite collide. You certainly can't accuse Red Bull of not letting their team-mates race.
2018-04-29T13:06:03Z: Leclerc passes Alonso to get back into the top 10. Leclerc's on a fresh set of softs, Alonso's been using his since his first lap repair stop.
2018-04-29T13:05:45Z: Bottas continues to make inroads on Vettel, bringing the gap down to 10.6s. That's not a huge concern to Ferrari, but it could catch Hamilton's attention as the Finn is quicker on 30-lap-old supersofts than the world champion is on four-lap-old softs.
2018-04-29T13:03:45Z: All pretty calm for Vettel out front at the moment.
2018-04-29T13:03:16Z: Perez is given a 5s time penalty for passing too soon at the restart - that'll hinder his pursuit of Leclerc, who's just pitted and fallen to 11th.
2018-04-29T13:03:09Z: Hamilton's exit from the pits in front of Verstappen has allowed Ricciardo to reduce the gap to his team-mate to just 1.3s.
2018-04-29T13:02:39Z: Vettel drops into the 1m47s now, but he's still 12 seconds ahead of Bottas, and lapping quicker than Hamilton is managing on fresh softs.
2018-04-29T13:01:56Z: Stroll pits from ninth, rejoining 12th with a set of softs.
2018-04-29T13:00:44Z: Vettel stays out, putting in an overall best middle sector. He crosses the line with a 1m46.5s, which is a few tenths off his best, but still decent pace. Hamilton was nearly nine seconds behind by the time he pitted, so Ferrari has a nice gap to play with.
2018-04-29T13:00:19Z: While Perez is under investigatio off-track, on it he's hacking into the gap to seventh-placed Leclerc.
2018-04-29T12:59:54Z: Perez is under investigation for overtaking before the safety car line.
2018-04-29T12:59:22Z: Sainz flies past Alonso to take 11th place.
2018-04-29T12:58:56Z: Vettel puts in a personal best 1m46.1s, just to add to Mercedes' misery.
2018-04-29T12:58:34Z: That puts Bottas up to second, but he is 12 seconds behind Vettel so it's all looking good for Ferrari at the moment. Hamilton takes a set of softs and rejoins.
2018-04-29T12:57:11Z: Sainz has been showing good pace since his pitstop and is soon going to be right behind Alonso for 11th.
2018-04-29T12:56:54Z: Hamilton has been off at Turn 1 - big lock up.
2018-04-29T12:55:46Z: Perez comes from a long way back to take eighth from Stroll into Turn 1. A possibly surprised Stroll locks up and runs wide.
2018-04-29T12:55:35Z: Verstappen has built a margin of a couple of seconds over Ricciardo now. Raikkonen is five seconds behind the second Red Bull.
2018-04-29T12:55:03Z: Another fastest lap for Hamilton - 1m46.1s, two tenths faster than Vettel again. The gap is 3.7s now.
2018-04-29T12:54:30Z: Ericsson gets a 10s time penalty for an earlier collision with Magnussen - that was during the opening-lap wildness.
2018-04-29T12:54:28Z: Hamilton reports that his front-right tyre is starting to give up. He's giving it everything to try to bring the gap down to Vettel to give Ferrari something to think about. Right now, Vettel has a bit of a margin to allow Ferrari to play it safe on strategy.
2018-04-29T12:53:29Z: Leclerc continues to look comfortable in seventh, with a 2s cushion over Stroll. But behind, Perez is closing on both of them fast.
2018-04-29T12:53:12Z: Another fastest lap for Hamilton, who brings the gap down to 4.0s to Vettel.
2018-04-29T12:51:36Z: Ericsson has a big lock-up and goes down an escape road while running by himself in 14th. He rejoins between Vandoorne and Gasly in 16th.
2018-04-29T12:51:27Z: Fastest lap for Hamilton - 1m46.597s. He's 4.2s off the lead.
2018-04-29T12:50:48Z: Ferrari says it will let Raikkonen know when he can use DRS.
2018-04-29T12:50:47Z: Vandoorne, who's had a pretty low-key weekend, pits from 13th place. He emerges 16th, with only Gasly behind him, and now on softs.
2018-04-29T12:48:43Z: Verstappen has clear track now Sainz has pitted, but he still has Ricciardo for company. They are half a minute off the lead though, after just 16 laps.
2018-04-29T12:48:18Z: Raikkonen takes Leclerc and is up to sixth. He's 32s off the lead, but not far behind the two Red Bulls.
2018-04-29T12:47:19Z: Hamilton has been wide at Turn 16, and he lost 1.1s to Vettel on that lap.
2018-04-29T12:47:11Z: Sainz's pitstop has put Leclerc's Sauber in a glorious sixth, but he has Raikkonen hot on his tail now.
2018-04-29T12:46:48Z: Sainz is back out in 13th with a set of softs and 35 laps to go.
2018-04-29T12:46:18Z: Sainz pits at the end of lap 15, as Verstappen breezes past.
2018-04-29T12:45:59Z: Sainz's ultrasofts seem to have given up.
2018-04-29T12:45:00Z: Verstappen has got back on Sainz's case now he's been able to shrug off Ricciardo for a bit.
2018-04-29T12:44:48Z: Raikkonen does get DRS fine on the main straight though and breezes past Stroll to take eighth. Next target is Leclerc.
2018-04-29T12:44:28Z: Vettel and Hamilton both put in 1m47.4s, keeping the gap at 3.5s between the top two. Bottas is now six seconds back.
2018-04-29T12:43:26Z: Force India is back into the top 10 after its miserable first lap - Perez is past Grosjean and into 10th.
2018-04-29T12:43:10Z: Having said it was calmer for Red Bull, Verstappen then runs massively wide over the kerb at the final corner but manages to keep momentum.
2018-04-29T12:42:58Z: Hamilton puts in a personal best of 1m47.0s, but that's still two tenths down on Vettel, who now leads by 3.6s.
2018-04-29T12:42:52Z: Bit calmer for Red Bull now, Verstappen has inched nearly a second clear of Ricciardo and they've both pulled clear of the Leclerc, Stroll, Raikkonen train.
2018-04-29T12:42:19Z: Gasly got rid of his ultrasofts and went to softs with that pitstop, but he's now a distant 17th and last.
2018-04-29T12:41:49Z: Vettel leads by 3.8s from Hamilton, while Bottas is 9.3s off the lead, and Sainz is 21.7s back.
2018-04-29T12:41:25Z: Gasly makes a pitstop, having drifted down the order following his brief post-safety-car appearance in seventh place.
2018-04-29T12:40:51Z: Replays of the Red Bull wheelbanging show that Verstappen left Ricciardo with no space on the outside on the exit of Turn 1 as he team-mate attacked.
2018-04-29T12:40:34Z: 1m46.8s for Vettel, 1m47.9s for Hamilton. The gap is now up to 3.4 seconds. Wow.
2018-04-29T12:40:08Z: Leclerc passed Stroll down the outside into Turn 1 last time and the Sauber is now right up behind the Red Bulls!
2018-04-29T12:40:06Z: Another fastest lap for Hamilton, but Vettel has turned the wick up this lap and is already more than a second quicker than him to extend the gap. We'll monitor it at the end of the lap.
2018-04-29T12:39:47Z: Verstappen locks up and Ricciardo has another look but there's no space.
2018-04-29T12:39:33Z: Ricciardo tries again down the outside into Turn 3, and is again held off.
2018-04-29T12:39:17Z: Ricciardo attacks Verstappen again, this time they bang wheels and Verstappen stays ahead!
2018-04-29T12:38:24Z: Hulkenberg is down an escape road, he lost the back end at Turn 4 and smashed his left-rear corner into the wall. Gutting for Renault.
2018-04-29T12:38:18Z: Perez is past Gasly into 11th, Alonso passes McLaren team-mate Vandoorne to take 13th.
2018-04-29T12:37:40Z: Ricciardo draws alongside Verstappen down the outside into Turn 1 but can't make it past. They're both under pressure from Stroll, Leclerc and Raikkonen.
2018-04-29T12:37:19Z: Hamilton takes four tenths out of Vettel with another fastest lap, so he's 2.3s down now on Vettel. 1m47.1s for the Mercedes.
2018-04-29T12:36:15Z: Making progress further back after their first-lap delays, Perez is now up to 13th and Alonso to 15th.
2018-04-29T12:35:39Z: Hulkenberg breezes past Verstappen on the start/finish straight. Verstappen picks up a tow and tries to fight back, but he's powerless. Two Renaults ahead of both Red Bulls now.
2018-04-29T12:35:06Z: Fastest lap for Hamilton - 1m47.8s, but Vettel has basically matched it. 2.7s between them.
2018-04-29T12:34:46Z: Hulkenberg is told of Verstappen's battery situation. Game on.
2018-04-29T12:34:39Z: Gasly is falling back rapidly, he's down to 11th as Raikkonen makes it into the top 10 and sets off after Leclerc and Stroll ahead.
2018-04-29T12:33:58Z: Ricciardo makes a small mistake in Turn 1, and Hulkenberg passes him at Turn 2! What a terrible couple of corners for Red Bull. Hulkenberg is now on Verstappen's case.
2018-04-29T12:33:33Z: Sainz passes Verstappen with the help of DRS into Turn 1!
2018-04-29T12:32:06Z: Hulkenberg flies past Gasly on the straight to take seventh from the Toro Rosso.
2018-04-29T12:31:56Z: Sainz has another go at Verstappen around the outside of Turn 1, but the Red Bull hangs on. Considering how much these two are fighting, it's strange that Ricciardo has fallen back from them.
2018-04-29T12:30:57Z: That restart has worked well for Vettel, even if it angered Hamilton. The Ferrari is 3.5s clear after 1.5 racing laps.
2018-04-29T12:30:30Z: Sainz has another go down the outside into Turn 3, but Verstappen holds on. Sainz is causing plenty of headaches for his 'parent' team here.
2018-04-29T12:30:08Z: Raikkonen starts making progress, he's past Vandoorne and into 11th.
2018-04-29T12:29:59Z: Sainz passes Verstappen on the start/finish straight, but he loses it back to the Red Bull on the brakes for Turn 1.
2018-04-29T12:28:58Z: Sainz gets in the mix with the Red Bulls as they fight, briefly gets ahead of both of them, but he can't make it stick ahead of Verstappen. The Red Bull junior - on loan at Renault - has picked off Ricciardo though, who loses two places in that shuffle.
2018-04-29T12:28:52Z: Hulkenberg capitalises on Stroll's loss of momentum too and takes eighth from the Williams.
2018-04-29T12:28:25Z: Great move from Gasly at the restart to take seventh from Stroll - Gasly was out in Q1 yesterday!
2018-04-29T12:28:16Z: Verstappen has a look round the outside of Ricciardo into Turn 1, and then mugs him down the inside into Turn 2 for fourth!
2018-04-29T12:27:36Z: Vettel backs the pack up a lot - now we are back to racing!
2018-04-29T12:26:40Z: Right, Vettel backs the pack up for the restart.
2018-04-29T12:23:54Z: Everyone who made a pitstop there took softs except Hartley, who went from softs to ultrasofts and is now 13th, and Grosjean, who went from softs to supersofts and is now 14th.
2018-04-29T12:23:08Z: Updated top 10 due to those pitstops for damaged cars: 1 Vettel, 2 Hamilton, 3 Bottas, 4 Ricciardo, 5 Verstappen, 6 Sainz, 7 Stroll, 8 Hulkenberg, 9 Gasly, 10 Leclerc.
2018-04-29T12:21:41Z: With so many cars pitting either for repairs or strategy tyre changes, Raikkonen has emerged back in 12th.
2018-04-29T12:21:19Z: Further replays now reveal it was Sirotkin who ran into the back of Perez rather than Stroll, with Sirotkin then pincered at high speed between Alonso and Hulkenberg on the next straight.
2018-04-29T12:20:27Z: Perez now pits to have the damage repaired.
2018-04-29T12:20:18Z: An overhead replay shot now shows fast-starting Lance Stroll clipping the back of Sergio Perez's Force India and sending it into the back of Raikkonen ahead.
2018-04-29T12:19:17Z: A replay suggests Alonso was three abreast with Sirotkin and Hulkenberg as the pack got messy following Force India-related contact ahead, and the Williams and McLaren made contact.
2018-04-29T12:18:38Z: Force India tells Perez, who's eighth, that he has enough damage to need a pitstop too.
2018-04-29T12:18:15Z: McLaren sends Alonso back out with new tyres and a new front wing.
2018-04-29T12:18:07Z: Vettel's start was so clean he didn't even give Hamilton a chance to challenge him on the short run to Turn 1. Sensible stuff from the Mercedes drivers to fall into line second and third behind the leader.
2018-04-29T12:18:01Z: Hartley, Magnussen and Ericsson have also taken advantage of this to pit.
2018-04-29T12:17:34Z: It's not just Alonso's right-front that's punctured, the right rear is in shreds too as he squirrels down the pitlane.
2018-04-29T12:16:50Z: Raikkonen does come into the pits, he needs a new front wing and also takes on soft tyres.
2018-04-29T12:16:26Z: Top 10 behind the safety car: 1 Vettel, 2 Hamilton, 3 Bottas, 4 Ricciardo, 5 Verstappen, 6 Raikkonen, 7 Sainz, 8 Stroll, 9 Perez, 10 Hulkenberg.
2018-04-29T12:16:16Z: Raikkonen might be OK, he's still running sixth.
2018-04-29T12:16:06Z: Alonso is running slowly with a punctured right front tyre too.
2018-04-29T12:15:33Z: Ocon is out, and Sirotkin is down the escape road too. Raikkonen is heading back to the pits.
2018-04-29T12:15:18Z: Raikkonen had lost a little ground in a jostle through the first corners, then tried to get down the inside of Ocon - who turned in and was spat into the wall.
2018-04-29T12:14:54Z: Ocon is in the wall after a clash with Raikkonen, that brings out the safety car immediately!
2018-04-29T12:14:32Z: Raikkonen had a look up the inside at the start but backed out of it into Turn 1.
2018-04-29T12:14:09Z: Clean Turn 1 at the front, Vettel holds the lead.
2018-04-29T12:13:39Z: The Mercedes drivers seemed to hang back a bit from Vettel to leave him on the grid as long as possible. Here we go...
2018-04-29T12:13:03Z: Plenty of weaving as the leaders complete the run down that hugely long straight and form up on the grid.
2018-04-29T12:10:52Z: The majority are on supersofts, except Raikkonen, the Force Indias, Renaults and Gasly on ultrasofts and Hartley and Grosjean on softs.
2018-04-29T12:10:16Z: The field sets off on the parade lap.
2018-04-29T12:07:39Z: All is ready for the formation lap... and it's a tad windy. #AzerbaijanGP
2018-04-29T12:05:58Z: So the starting grid looks like this:1 Vettel2 Hamilton3 Bottas4 Ricciardo5 Verstappen6 Raikkonen7 Ocon8 Perez9 Sainz10 Stroll11 Sirotkin12 Alonso13 Leclerc14 Hulkenberg15 Magnussen16 Vandoorne17 Gasly18 Ericsson19 Hartley20 Grosjean
2018-04-29T12:00:48Z: Just one actual grid penalty of note - Nico Hulkenberg drops from ninth to 14th due to a gearbox change. Romain Grosjean would get a grid penalty for component changes too, but he was already at the back in 20th after his gearbox refused to cooperate when he was trying to get out of an escape road in Q1.
2018-04-29T11:58:35Z: It's not ideal for Kimi Raikkonen to be starting down in sixth, or to be starting on an ultrasoft tyre no one is keen to run, but Mercedes isn't counting him out - in fact, team boss Toto Wolff thinks Ferrari's Finn is the man to watch: Mercedes fears Kimi Raikkonen strategy gamble in Azerbaijan GPKimi Raikkonen should have been the man to beat in the Azerbaijan Grand Prix and is still a threat despite his qualifying error, believes Mercedes Formula 1 boss Toto Wolff
2018-04-29T11:56:26Z: Here's a reminder of what happened in qualifying - Sebastian Vettel and Ferrari on pole, again.
